Parameter.Name: Direction
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: Direction for a Numeric sensor value to change.
Used in Sensor Change Modes that have an Amount input.
0 = Increase
1 = Decrease
2 = Any

Parameter.Name: Port
Parameter.Description: Many programming blocks require that you select the ports on the EV3 Brick (A, B, C, D, 1, 2, 3, and 4) that these blocks will use. The Port Selectors are in the top right-hand corner of these blocks.

Parameter.Name: Comparison
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 - 5
Notes: 0: = (Equal to)
1: ≠ (Not Equal to)
2: > (Greater than)
3: ≥ (Greater than or Equal to)
4: < (Less than)
5: ≤ (Less than or Equal to)

Parameter.Name: Threshold Value
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: Any number
Notes: Value to compare sensor data to

Parameter.Name: Amount
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: Amount for sensor value to change in a Sensor Change Mode

Parameter.Name: Value
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Notes: The sensor data value used for a Compare mode.

Parameter.Name: Result
Parameter.Description:
Type: Logic
Notes: True/False result of a Compare mode.

Parameter.Name: CalibrateValueMin
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 – 100
Notes: Light intensity for Calibrate modes

Parameter.Name: CalibrateValueMax
Parameter.Description:
Type: Numeric
Allowed Values: 0 – 100
Notes: Light intensity for Calibrate modes

Block.Description: The Measure – Reflected Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.
The Measure – Ambient Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

Each of the sensor types listed in the Wait block has one or more Change modes. A Change mode will continuously read data from the sensor and wait for it to change to a different value, or change by an amount that you specify. You can wait for some types of sensor data to change by a certain Amount, and other types to change to a different value.

Mode: Light Sensor - Compare - Reflected Light Intensity
Use: Wait for the reflected light intensity to reach a certain value.

Mode: Light Sensor - Compare - Ambient Light Intensity
Use: Wait for the ambient light intensity to reach a certain value.

Mode: Light Sensor - Reflected Light Intensity
Use: Repeat a sequence of blocks until the reflected light intensity reaches a certain value.

Mode: Light Sensor - Ambient Light Intensity
Use: Repeat a sequence of blocks until the ambient light intensity reaches a certain value.

Mode: Light Sensor - Compare - Reflected Light Intensity
Use: Choose between two sequences of blocks depending on the reflected light intensity.

Mode: Light Sensor - Compare - Ambient Light Intensity
Use: Choose between two sequences of blocks depending on the ambient light intensity.
The Calibrate – Minimum mode allows you to specify the minimum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Light Sensor will report this light intensity as 0 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Maximum mode allows you to specify the maximum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Light Sensor will report this light intensity as 100 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Reset mode restores the Light Sensor calibration to its default state.
